title: Carlos Alberto Montaner, Prominent Critic of Castro’s Cuba, Dies at 80
description: After fleeing the island in 1961, he became one of the leading voices of opposition against the country’s Communist dictatorship.

title: Israeli Reservists Threaten Mass Resignations if Judicial Plan Proceeds
description: Military reserves are critical to Israel’s operational readiness. Reservists are again using that leverage against the government’s effort to curb judicial power.

title: Netanyahu Rushed to Hospital, but in ‘Good Condition,’ His Office Says
description: Israel’s prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, went to the hospital suddenly on Saturday afternoon. Mr. Netanyahu, 73, is currently facing one of the most testing phases of his political career.

title: Russia Doing ‘Everything’ to Stop Ukraine’s Counteroffensive, Zelensky Says
description: The Ukrainian leader has secured new weapons pledges, but it was not clear when the aid would arrive, or how consequential it would be on the battlefield.

title: Poland Doesn’t Want Migrants, but These Foreign Workers Are Welcome
description: A tiny village is taking in 6,000 laborers from Asia. They are needed by a petroleum company controlled by the right-wing government, which has vowed to keep migrants out.

title: Appleby Horse Fair Draws Thousands of Gypsies and Travellers
description: The Appleby Horse Fair draws tens of thousands of Gypsies and Irish Travellers each year to a rural patch of England to celebrate their culture. Our photographer spent four days there.

title: Reconsidering the Staycation
description: You don’t necessarily have to travel to experience the benefits of a summer vacation.

title: Frank Gehry Returns to the Streets of His Canadian Childhood
description: The renowned architect was back in Toronto for the start of construction on his second project in the city where he was born and raised.

title: Russian Forces Are Doing ‘Everything They Can’ to Stop Counteroffensive, Zelensky Says
description: The Ukrainian leader secured new weapons pledges this week from allies, but it was not clear how soon they would arrive, or how significant a boost they could provide to Ukraine’s slow push to take back territory.

title: Canadian Politicians Who Criticize China Become Its Targets
description: As China increases its reach in diaspora communities, Chinese Canadian politicians in Vancouver are the focus of Chinese state interference in Canadian politics.

title: After Suffering Heavy Losses, Ukrainians Paused to Rethink Strategy
description: Early in the counteroffensive, Ukraine lost as much as 20 percent of its weapons and armor. The rate dropped as the campaign slowed and commanders shifted tactics.

title: As U.S. and China Resume Climate Talks, Here’s Where Things Stand
description: John Kerry travels to Beijing for three days of talks, as the world’s two biggest economies, and two biggest polluters, try to cooperate on climate action.

title: Floods and Landslides in South Korea After Heavy Rain
description: The deaths occurred on Friday and Saturday, the authorities said. Seven others were injured.
